issues.title: fb-adb shell = tcsetattr(0): Invalid argument
issues.body:
I build fb-adb on linux/amd64 revision b931596ba004348906e707189d3305332b50e406

```sh
$ ./fb-adb shell
fb-adb shell: trouble starting adb stub: fb-adb.8703cf1f99e6dda7228b stub: tcsetattr(0): Invalid argument
```

and no shell, `adb shell` works fine on my machine.
I tryied to connect to nexus 5.

issues.title: Missing binaries for 10.12 on Brew
issues.body:
The advice in `README.md` to run just `brew install fb-adb` is no longer valid.

Brew can't compile fb-adb right now due to https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/7325 (which is posted here as #52).

There's no (binary) bottle for 10.12 (Sierra) either. See https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/master/Formula/fb-adb.rb.

# Temporary Workaround

```bash
nitro:build dave$ brew install --force-bottle fb-adb
==> Downloading https://homebrew.bintray.com/bottles/fb-adb-1.4.4.el_capitan.bottle.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Pouring fb-adb-1.4.4.el_capitan.bottle.tar.gz
==> Using the sandbox
==> echo Y | android update sdk --no-ui --filter platform-tools
🍺  /usr/local/Cellar/fb-adb/1.4.4: 6 files, 298K
nitro:build dave$ brew install android-platform-tools
==> Using the sandbox
==> Downloading https://dl.google.com/android/repository/platform-tools_r25.0.3-darwin.zip
Already downloaded: /Users/dave/Library/Caches/Homebrew/android-platform-tools-25.0.3.zip
🍺  /usr/local/Cellar/android-platform-tools/25.0.3: 5 files, 3.3M, built in 1 second
```

issues.title: Exit code not propagated when instrumentation test fails
issues.body:
Running an instrumentation test still returns 0 exit code when the test fails. Am I missing something here?

```
fb-adb shell am instrument -w -r   -e package com.xxxxxx.android.espresso.notification -e debug false com.xxxxxx.android.test/android.support.test.runner.AndroidJUnitRunner

<Truncated output>

Caused by: junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Unable to send a test notification
    at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:50)
    at com.xxxxxx.android.espresso.notification.PushNotificationTest$2.call(PushNotificationTest.java:84)
    at com.xxxxxx.android.espresso.notification.PushNotificationTest$2.call(PushNotificationTest.java:80)
    at rx.internal.util.ActionSubscriber.onError(ActionSubscriber.java:44)
    at rx.observers.SafeSubscriber._onError(SafeSubscriber.java:157)
    at rx.observers.SafeSubscriber.onError(SafeSubscriber.java:120)
    at rx.internal.operators.OperatorObserveOn$ObserveOnSubscriber.checkTerminated(OperatorObserveOn.java:264)
    at rx.internal.operators.OperatorObserveOn$ObserveOnSubscriber.call(OperatorObserveOn.java:207)
    at rx.android.schedulers.LooperScheduler$ScheduledAction.run(LooperScheduler.java:107)
    at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739)
    at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
    at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148)
    at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5417)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726)
    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616)

INSTRUMENTATION_STATUS: current=1
INSTRUMENTATION_STATUS_CODE: -2
INSTRUMENTATION_RESULT: shortMsg=junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
INSTRUMENTATION_RESULT: longMsg=junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Unable to send a test notification
INSTRUMENTATION_CODE: 0

$ echo $?
0
```

issues.title: __system_property_* are deprecated, not available on new platforms
issues.body:
Lollipop introduced support for 64bit platforms (aarch64, x86_64, mips64). According to [android/platform_ndk#143627](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=143627) `<sys/system_properties.h>` can no longer be used: ABI hidden in `libc.so` but not `libc.a`. For one, 4a9648e leads to

```
/tmp/ccVrqi5L.ltrans2.ltrans.o: In function `api_level':
util.c:1391: undefined reference to `__system_property_get'
/tmp/ccVrqi5L.ltrans3.ltrans.o: In function `compat_property_foreach.lto_priv.74':
cmd_getprop.c:193: undefined reference to `__system_property_find_nth'
/tmp/ccVrqi5L.ltrans3.ltrans.o: In function `property_compare':
cmd_getprop.c:123: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
cmd_getprop.c:124: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
/tmp/ccVrqi5L.ltrans8.ltrans.o: In function `getprop_main':
cmd_getprop.c:312: undefined reference to `__system_property_find'
cmd_getprop.c:315: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
cmd_getprop.c:312: undefined reference to `__system_property_find'
cmd_getprop.c:315: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
cmd_getprop.c:288: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
/tmp/ccVrqi5L.ltrans14.ltrans.o: In function `make_abi_mask':
cmd_stub.c:649: undefined reference to `__system_property_find'
cmd_stub.c:651: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
cmd_stub.c:654: undefined reference to `__system_property_find'
cmd_stub.c:656: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
cmd_stub.c:660: undefined reference to `__system_property_find'
cmd_stub.c:662: undefined reference to `__system_property_read'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

issues.title: environment variables don't work with rdex
issues.body:
I'm getting this error with rdex:
E/AndroidRuntime(15136): Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Couldn't load keyboard from loader dalvik.system.PathClassLoader[DexPathList[[zip file "/data/local/tmp/rdex/keyboard_apk.jar"],nativeLibraryDirectories=[/vendor/lib, /system/lib]]]: findLibrary returned null

The path I tried to set with -Y"LD_LIBRARY_PATH=..." doesn't show up in nativeLibraryDirectories above, so I think this is a problem with rdex. It does work with fb-adb shell, so I'm guessing this is a problem with rdex.

issues.title: long form force tty option doesn't work
issues.body:
fb-adb -t shell works, but fb-adb --force-tty shell does not:
fb-adb: unknown command --force-tty

issues.title: fb-adb shell gives confusing error message
issues.body:
`$ fb-adb shell ls`
`fb-adb shell: adb error: failed to copy '/tmp/fb-adb-ovCQRP' to '/data/local/tmp/fb-adb.bc60fb8f679fc9509d17': Permission denied`

I'm seeing this on a Nexus 5 running Lollipop userdebug build. It happens when the phone is partially off. When I touch the power button I see a battern icon, with an animation indicating it is charging. Surprisingly, "adb shell" works. But fb-adb shell gives the above error message.

Turn on the device and everything works again. So it's not terribly high pri.

commits.message: Skip clowny output lines in another context
Tune transfer for higher-latency links; fix adbenc bug
Add ping command

Look up __system_property_find_nth dynamically

Some very recent Android systems don't have a
__system_property_find_nth, making the fb-adb stub fail to load.
We need this symbol only on very old Android versions, ones lacking
__system_property_foreach, so just load both symbols dynamically.

Always get a PTY even with newer adb

New versions of ADB have improved the shell command so that it's
clean, propagates error codes, and allocates PTYs unconditionally,
much like ssh.  This last change breaks fb-adb, since we run the
inferior adb with pipes for stdio; ADB thinks it's being run
non-interactively, skips allocating a PTY on the device side.
The remote shell doesn't have a pty itself, so _it_ thinks it's being
run non-interactively, so it doesn't print a prompt.  Meanwhile,
fb-adb hangs because it's waiting forever for a prompt.

This change just gets us back to using a PTY unconditionally.
We could take advantage of adb fixes to get rid of some of our
encoding logic, but that's a separate project.
Fix write beyond end of stack when an error converter goes unused
Have configure script check that Android SDK includes API 19 link library
Remove creation of empty toolchain directory: it confuses newer versions of the NDK
Unbreak bash completion
Rename finfo; add jdwp proxy; add pidof command
Try using service on Samsung S7
Fix su
SIGTTIN handling
Move daemon sigchld reaper closer to main loop

commit_comments.body:
> This makes release builds non-deterministic again.

The build will be deterministic after the stubs are stripped, since the non-determinism is part of the debug information.

> Did you mean if !STUB_LOCAL as -flto may not work with host toolchain?

Yes, that's better.

review_comments.body: Because then you need a cast at the call site. In C, any pointer can be implicitly converted to void*, but to convert to a void**, you need extra syntax.

issues.title: Merge to AOSP
issues.body:
This fork is super useful, adding new features and significantly improving on functionality in the original upstream ADB. It would be wonderful if these changes were merged back to the source so it's trivial to download via the SDK manager. Although it is not an explicit goal of this project, merging upstream is a written objective for the Facebook ProGuard fork:

> The goal of this fork is to remain bit-for-bit compatible with upstream, and to ideally get these patches into upstream proguard.

This ticket is to request that changes in this fork be merged back to AOSP so all users may benefit.

issue_comments.body:
> configure: error: could not find Android cross-compiler for i686-pc-linux-android
> configure: error: ../../stub-x86/configure failed for stub-x86

I had a similar issue on Mac. I resolved it by downgrading my NDK from "android-ndk-r10b" to "android-ndk-r10". No other changes were necessary.

@dcolascione apologies for the lack of detail. When experiencing problems, sometimes it is easy to mistakenly assume an issue is self evident. I dug into this a little more. The cause is actually that I'm using the 64b target NDK (android-ndk64-r10b-darwin-x86_64.tar.bz2). The 32b target NDK (android-ndk32-r10b-darwin-x86_64.tar.bz2) works fine. I can provide my config.log on request (GitHub only supports image attachments).
@dcolascione sent!
This is no longer issue using r10c for Mac.

commits.message: Fix -Werror=overflow

Fix deprecated warnings with major() on glibc 2.25

https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Release/2.25#Packaging_Changes

Fix building with NDK r15 beta2

NDK r15 will default to unified headers, which requires an extra
-D__ANDROID_API__=XX in $CPPFLAGS

Merge pull request #57 from dcolascione/master

Skip clowny output lines in another context

Merge pull request #56 from dcolascione/master

Look up __system_property_find_nth dynamically, add ping/echo, tune transfer for higher-latency links and fix adbenc bug

review_comments.body: nit: why not just type `fnptr_v` as it actually is; `void**`? i know there's no real difference between `void*` and `void**` but this line was a source of confusion for a minute.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #54 from mzlee/version-bump

Version bump
Version bump

Merge pull request #51 from dcolascione/master

Update fb-adb to work with Nougat adb

Merge pull request #42 from dlitz/fix-twrp-recovery

Fix error "[child] expected 0x65 e, found 0x1b ." on some firmwares.

Merge pull request #43 from mzlee/perms

Update the permissions so the python scripts are executable
Update the permissions so the python scripts are executable

Replace chat_swallow_prompt with new flag on chat_talk_at (Internal API)

We can't reliably swallow all prompt-related escape sequences until
after we begin sending a command to the shell, so the ability to call
chat_swallow_prompt separately from chat_talk_at was misleading.

chat_swallow_prompt is now an implementation detail of chat_talk_at,
which accepts a new CHAT_SWALLOW_PROMPT flag to enable prompt-swallowing
behavior.

Fix error "[child] expected 0x65 e, found 0x1b ." on some firmwares.

This occurs when busybox is built with FEATURE_EDITING_ASK_TERMINAL,
such as on TWRP recovery firmwares.

(Note that /system must be mounted before connecting to a recovery
firmware with fb-adb.)

pull_requests.title: Mention the Android SDK in the build instructions
pull_requests.body: The build instructions don't mention setting the ANDROID_SDK variable which I had to do to get it working.  This patch just adds mention of that.
